Instructions

This project is a frontend implementation of the new Pastor Chris Online website. It is built with the following technologies:

 

1. Foundation Framework

Foundation is a responsive frontend framework. It contains CSS and HTML based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, tables, grids, navigation, and other interface components, as well as optional JavaScript extensions. Foundation is available via npm:

2. Gulp

Gulp is a toolkit for automating painful or time-consuming tasks in your development workflow, so you can stop messing around and build something. Gulp is available via npm. Learn more about Gulp.

3. Pug

Pug is a high-performance template engine heavily influenced by Haml and implemented with JavaScript for Node.js and browsers. Pug is available via npm: Learn more about Pug.

4. Typescript

Typescript is a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript. It is available via npm: Learn more about Typescript.

5. SASS

SASS is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into Cascading Style Sheets. It is available via npm: Learn more about SASS.

6. Webpack

Webpack is a module bundler. Its main purpose is to bundle JavaScript files for usage in a browser, yet it is also capable of transforming, bundling, or packaging just about any resource or asset. It is available via npm: Learn more about Webpack.

Folder structure

  • dist
    • assets
      • css
      • fonts
      • img
      • js
    • index.html
  • src
    • fonts
    • iconfonts
    • img
    • js
    • pug
    • sass
      • base
      • components
      • mixins
      • page
      • sections
      • _color-creator.scss
      • _settings.scss
      • fonts.scss
      • style.scss
    • ts
    • icon-font-template.scss
  • .gitignore
  • gulpfile.js
  • makefile
  • package.json
  • README.md
  • tsconfig.json
  • typings.json
  • webpack.config.js
  • yarn.lock

1. src
This folder contains all the source files for the project. It contains the following sub-folders: fonts, iconfonts, img, js, pug, sass, ts

2. fonts
This folder holds the fonts 'Graphik' and all other associated fonts required for the website.

3. iconfonts
This folder contains svg files which are automatically converted to iconfonts using the icon-font-template.scssfile, during the build process. To add an svg icon to the set, simply add the svg file to this folder.

4. img
This folder contains all the images used in the project.

5. pug
This folder contains all the pug files used in the project. The index.pug file is the entry point for the project

6. ts
This folder contains all the typescript files used in the project. The main.ts file is the entry point for the typescript files. The typescript files are compiled to javascript files in the dist/assets/js folder.

7. sass
This folder contains all the sass files used in the project. The main.scss file is the entry point for the stylesheets. The sass files not starting with "_" are compiled to css files in the dist/assets/css folder.

_settings.scsscontains the Foundation Framework settings. Please check the table of content for an idea of what is configurable.

The basefolder contains extensions that implements the typography, colors, and other base styles.

The mixinsfolder contains special helper functions that can be used in the sass files. The sections contains styles for specific sections of the website, like the header, footer, etc.

The componentsfolder contains styles for specific components of the website, like buttons, forms, etc. This is where most of the atomic styles reside.

Starting the project

Clone this repository and run the following commands in the root directory of the project: npm installor yarn installthen run npm startor yarn startthis will install the required node modules and start the build process. Subsequently, just run npm start or yarn start to begin the build process.

Quick note: all styles in the "_docs" folder, both in the sass and pug files, are not compiled to the final css and html files. They are only used for the documentation. Remember to remove or disable them before building your final frontend project.

Typography

The typography is based on the Graphik font family. Styles are provide for the standard HTML header tags: H1 ,H2, H3, H4, H5, H6, and the p and small tags. Large styles xxlarge, xlarge and large above the H1 tag Styles are also provided for small, extra-small and xx-small. As well as being able to use the standard HTML tags, you can also use the .xxlarge, .xlarge, .large .h1, .h2, .h3, .h4, .h5, .h6 classes.

The types change responsively based on the screen size. To configure the properties of the typography elements, please check the /src/sass/base/_typography.scss file. You can also check /src/sass/_settings.scss file to see other configurable items.

Colors

Colors are divided into Primary, Tints and Shades. All colors are available as sass variables in the /src/sass/base/color.scssfile. The primary colors are: $blue, $navy, $anchor, $purple, $black, $violet, $electric and $white.

Colors can also be accessed using special helper classes in HTML: For example, .c-blue to change the colour to blue and .bg-blue to change the background to blue.

Icons

Icons are svg files which are converted to iconfonts during the build process. The icons were designed on a 128x128 grid for proper scale adjustments and to enable consistent in all icons. For stroke-heavy icons, the stroke width at the 128 scale should be 4px.

To add an icon to the set, simply add the svg file to the /src/iconfonts folder.

To use an icon, simply add the class .icon-{icon-name} to the icon element. For example, to use the audio icon, add the class .icon-audio to the icon element. See /src/sass/components/_iconfonts.scss for the full list of icon classes.

Icon Sizes

We have special scale size classes for icons. These classes are used to scale the icons to the appropriate size. The scale sizes increases by a factor of "4" from 4 till 256. To scale an icon, simply add the class .icon-{size} to the icon element. For example, to scale an icon to 64px, add the class .icon-64 to the icon element. See /src/sass/components/_icons.scss for the full list of scale size classes.

Scale sizes are also available for multiple breakpoints (small, medium, large). To use the scale size classes for a specific breakpoint, simply add the breakpoint name to the class. For example, to scale an icon to 64px on medium screens, add the class .medium-icon-64 to the icon element.

Country Flags

Country flags are circular SVG images with a transparent background. To use the flags in your project, simply add the following code to your HTML: <img src="/assets/img/flags/{country-code}.svg" alt="{country-name}" />. For example, to use the flag of Australia, add the following code to your HTML: <img src="img/flags/au.svg" alt="Australia" />. See the list of country codes below or click here to view the list of country codes on Wikipedia.

Flag Sizes

We have special scale classes for flags. These classes are used to scale the flags to the appropriate size. The scale sizes increases by a factor of "4" from 4 till 256. To scale a flag, simply add the class .flag-w{size} to the icon element. For example, to scale an icon to 64px, add the class .flag-w64 to the img tag. See /src/sass/components/_flags.scss for the full list of scale classes.

Scale sizes are also available for multiple breakpoints (small, medium, large). To use the scale size classes for a specific breakpoint, simply add the breakpoint name to the class. For example, to scale a flag to 64px on medium screens, add the class .medium-flag-w64 to the icon element.
